the coordinators recommendations i take will be endorsed by the committee under rule tool five sent so we come to point seven welcome to our four members now

ar core work on asylum and migration and integration and one of the key topics with the challenges faced by third countries in receiving large numbers of refugees and how the eu could support those countries against the backdrop of recent commission communications and establishing partnership framework with third countries

in this respect the delegation report also link to the opinioned of vergia on addressing refugee in migrant movements and various other reports colleagues here are well versed in those and of course also we highlighted on the visit the

visit and i would like to thank the secretariat we were it was it was extremely intensive visit not just with the ngos but the refugees themselves who were going to be resettled many of them any eu countries and in norway we looked very closely at the

the sheer numbers that were in lebanon a country which is now essentially a refugee country and we were able to understand the pressures there but also the combined pressures of the big syrian population also in lebanon

added to that the existing palestinian refugee population in that country i think the key points if we have to be very honest were to examine the number of differences between the numbers poring into that that area and the relative numbers

in the european union not with standing the generous numbers taken by particularly germany and sweden but not with standing and austria but not with sanding those numbers the sheer pressure of displacement in those countries i think this was the key
i take away from the delegation visit in terms of practical points in relation to ira legislation and work again we are looking at resettlement and relocation but i think we were
in a put in a very difficult context where we realise that we are doing a very minimal amount of practical work in relation to what is an enormous problem so

it was a very sobering visit in that respect but there was a sense of urgency about the need to have a coherent relocation resettlement and coherent policy in relation to partnership so i think that was the urgency and the visit

and of course we we built a better partnership with the ngos in the un through the delegation visit so for all of those reasons it was extremely useful for the delegation there were no breaks in the delegation visit was extremely intense from start to finish the budget committee budget control committee also accompanied us and also lain to jordan

i think that was particularly useful in terms of thin tomes when there from the budget control committee and i think that was particularly useful in terms of understanding the eu contribution which is of course huge in this area in terms of ongoing aid
